meanings.definition: In a hesitant or indecisive manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked irresolutely at the menu, unable to decide what to order.
meanings.sent2: He walked irresolutely back and forth in front of the store, unsure whether to go in.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared irresolutely at the open door, unsure if it wanted to go outside or stay in.
meanings.sent4: The clouds drifted irresolutely across the sky, unable to decide whether to bring rain or sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The child stood irresolutely at the edge of the pool, afraid to jump in.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of determination or firmness.
meanings.sent1: Her irresolutely folded paper airplane barely flew a few feet before falling to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The irresolutely built sandcastle crumbled as soon as the tide came in.
meanings.sent3: The tree swayed irresolutely in the wind, unsure whether to bend or break.
meanings.sent4: His irresolutely tied shoelaces came undone as soon as he started running.
meanings.sent5: The irresolutely drawn line wavered and faded, lacking the boldness of a permanent marker.
